article_title: Same-sex marriage gets the green light in N.J.: Today's Page 1
article_text:
Here is an interactive image of today’s Star-Ledger front page, with links to our top stories. Clicking on a headline will bring you to a story or topic page.

The New Jersey Supreme Court, in a unanimous decision, refused to delay the start of gay marriages, as Gov. Chris Christie had requested. Marriages are expected to begin as soon as 12:01 a.m. Monday. From a legal standpoint, Christie’s basis for opposing same-sex marriage was flat-out rejected in the decision. And days before its opening, a medical marijuana clinic dedicates its building to a patient advocate.

All of these stories and more can be found in the Saturday Star-Ledger. Click here if you’re interested in home delivery.
